newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-JOUBERT SCORES HAT-TRICK AS NATAL WIN 35-26.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-JOUBERT SCORES HAT-TRICK AS NATAL WIN 35-26.

text.p: Natal centre Joos Joubert ran in a hat-trick of tries as last year's losing finalists beat Australian Capital Territory (ACT) 35-26 in their Super 12 match at Kings Park on Sunday.
But Natal, who led 23-0 at halftime, had to weather a strong performance from the ACT Brumbies in the opening and final quarters of the game to secure their second, successive win in the competition.
Both sides put in a series of bruising tackles in defence and also played expansively enough to score four tries apiece.

Despite being under considerable pressure from a committed ACT side for the opening half hour, Natal led 9-0 through three penalties from the reliable boot of full-back Gavin Lawless who went on to collect 18 points.
Then, largely against the run of play, Natal went further ahead with the first of Joubert's tries.

Sustained pressure after Natal's first genuine assault on the ACT line finally told when the powerful inside centre, cousin of injured Springbok full-back Andre Joubert, went over in the left-hand corner. Lawless converted.
Just two minutes later, left wing Cabous van der Westhuizen chipped ahead twice to launch a brilliant counter-attack from the kick-off and Joubert scored right under the posts.
Lawless then took Natal into the break with a solid 23-0 advantage after his fifth successful kick at goal.

ACT finally posted their first points on the board with a try in the 51st minute when lock John Langford fought his way over after the Brumbies engineered a powerful rolling maul from a line-out five metres out.
But, four minutes later, Joubert scored his third after an attempted George Gregan clearance rebounded off centre Jeremy Thomson for Joubert to win the race to the touchdown.

Although Wallaby left wing Joe Roff ran the length of the field to score after an interception, Natal flyhalf Henry Honiball laid on a fourth try for his team when he sliced through the ACT defence for replacement flanker Walter Minnaar to score.
ACT hooker Marco Caputo and fullback Stephen Larkham both scored tries in the last seven minutes of the match to secure the Brumbies a consolation point for scoring four tries.

Natal - Gavin Lawless; Dirkie Strydom, Jeremy Thomson, Joos Joubert, Cabous van der Westhuizen; Henry Honiball, Kevin Putt; Gary Teichmann (captain), Dieter Kriese, Wayne Fyvie (Walter Minnaar, 52nd), Mark Andrews, John Slade, Adrian Garvey, John Allan, Rob Kempson (Ollie le Roux, 52nd)

ACT - Stephen Larkham; Mitch Hardy, Adam Magro, Pat Howard (James Holbeck, 73rd), Joe Roff; Geoff Logan (David Knox, 42nd), George Gregan; Troy Coker, Brett Robinson, Ipolito Fenukitau, David Giffen, John Langford, Dean Zammt (Rod Moore 57th), Marco Caputo, Patricio Noriega.
